page.title: 04COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: A daily{postal service}operates for the delivery letters and parcels from Mondays to Saturdays. Collections are made from the post office at Rhydycroesau each morning and after- noon from Monday to Friday and also on Saturday mornings. There is no Sunday service.There are three roadside{ {letter boxes}from which letters are collected daily - one is at Pant Glas and the others are at points beside the Oswestry to Llansilin road. The {telephone}saves much travelling time in a country area and is a vital link for remoter cottages which may be cut off for several days by heavy snow- falls in winter. Public{telephone {kiosks}are located at Rhydycroesau and Pant Glas. They are of the old design with small glass panes, unlike many elsewhere in the country which are being replaced by modern designs.
